name: df-lat
body: |- wceq(clat, crab(s0, cpo, wa(wceq(cdm(cfv(cjn, cv(s0))), cxp(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))), wceq(cdm(cfv(cmee, cv(s0))), cxp(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ Lat = { s0 ∈ Poset |(dom((join ` s0))=((Base ` s0)×(Base ` s0))∧ dom((meet ` s0))=((Base ` s0)×(Base ` s0)))}
comment: Define the class of all lattices. A lattice is a poset in which the join and meet of any two elements always exists. (Contributed by NM, 18-Oct-2012.) (Revised by NM, 12-Sep-2018.)
